run_ga moduleÂ¶

A genetic algorithm script separate from the glyP package but implements functions of the glyP package. The genetic algorithm selects the most optimal performing conformer quantified by it's free energy. In each iteration mutated conformers (changes to the glycosidic bond angle) are generated and added to the list of existing conformers. Then all conformers are sorted and only n number of conformers are kept in the alive pool to keep mutating (n = 'alive_pool' specified in the GA settings). Over multiple iterations and mutations to the most successful set the most optimal conformation will be determined. Currently there is only mutations to conformers implemented and no crossovers, where a new conformer can be generated with attributes of another conformer in the alive pool.

Usage: Run this script separately: python3 run_ga.py The script will print out the pool of existing molecules selected by the genetic algorithm over multiple generations (iterations)
